Ω(..).register() Are you sick and tired of the old divs and hassle with the same old tags?? Custags.js is here to bacome your saviour. With just a few lines of JS, rock with your custom elements. Each defined custom element ships with a id named by its tag name. Like this:- 
            <yo-elemnt></yo-elemnt>
            <!--Defined as a h1. Will be processed as-->
            <h1 id="yo-elemnt></h1>
If your syntax markup is like this 
      <chat-app>
            <text-module></text-module>
            <submit-btn>Submit</submit-btn>
      </chat-app>
Wherein the chat-app is the wrapper div, the text-module is the input tag, and the submit-btn is the button. Custags.js makes it easier than ever to define them without any hassle. To define them, you do this in javascript: 
      Ω('chat-app').register(div);
      Ω('text-module').register(inputText);
      Ω('submit-btn').register(button);
If you want to do something on clicking the button, and want a reference, just put a # before the tag name as the selector, like this:- 
            Ω('#submit-btn').on('click', ()=>{
            alert(Ω('#text-module').val());
            //or document.querySelector('#text-module').value;   
            });
Check the combined demo below:- Submit Custom Element in Custom Element If you need to make a new element of yourself, you can do that, like this:- See the Pen Custom element using Custags.js by Pranav Karawale (@obnoxiousnerd) on CodePen.
